notes.text:
The python-keystoneclient was updated to fix one security issues.

The following vulnerability was fixed:
- bsc#928205: S3Token TLS cert verification option not honored (CVE-2015-1852)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: The s3_token middleware in OpenStack keystonemiddleware before 1.6.0 and python-keystoneclient before 1.4.0 disables certification verification when the "insecure" option is set in a paste configuration (paste.ini) file regardless of the value, which allows remote attackers to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks via a crafted certificate, a different vulnerability than CVE-2014-7144.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

fixed: SUSE Cloud Compute Node for SUSE Linux Enterprise 12 5:python-keystoneclient-1.0.0-16.1.noarch
SUSE Cloud Compute Node for SUSE Linux Enterprise 12 5:python-keystoneclient-doc-1.0.0-16.1.noarch

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".
